Dissolution of "Intelligence Service" called for
articles.content:
Dissolution of "Intelligence Service" called for
   Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland, answering the question put by KCNA on June 14, denounced the anti-north confrontation outcry of Chon Yong Thaek, chief of the South Korean "Intelligence Service," and demanded his removal and the dissolution of the service.   While at the ministerial post of "national defence", Chon proclaimed the north as the "principal enemy" and ran amok in the moves for confrontation with the north and war of aggression on it.   
   The South Korean chief executive, instead of removing such a devil, appointed him to the post of the chief of the service, the headquarters of the anti-north plot-breeding moves, the spokesman said, and went on:   This fully shows the ulterior intention of the South Korean authorities to further aggravate inter-Korean relations and block peace and peaceful reunification.
   If the chief executive of South Korea sincerely wants to improve inter-Korean relations, he should not resort to "engagement policy" but oust such an anti-north confrontation as Chon Yong Thaek and dissolve the service.

articles.content:
S. Korean authorities' moves to stamp out labour  movement
    Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- The South Korean prosecution recently arrested and indicted 11 senior unionists who organised the strike of the Seoul Subway trade union in April.    Rodong Sinmun today carries a signed commentary in this regard.
   The commentary says:   It is another premeditated move to block the worker's struggle for vital rights and democracy.   
   The South Korean authorities let the prosecution "induce" the mint co. trade union to strike with a view to suppressing  and obliterating  trade unions. The prosecution is notorious as the second "Intelligence Service," which reveals South Korea is a theatre of fascist Rowdyism and a hell on earth.   The South Korean rulers, who turned the sites of the worker's strikes into pools of blood and arrested senior unionists even after "inducing trade union to strike," are the fascist tyrants and plotters surpassing the preceding dictators.
